setContent.text:
Scholarly Publications

One aspect of learning to evaluate sources is to understand the different types of periodical publications.

A periodical is a publication with issues that appear at regular intervals. For example, the New York Times comes out daily, Nature comes out weekly, and the Journal of Psychiatry & Neuroscience comes out every other month.

Three Kinds of Periodicals

Periodicals fall into three basic categories: popular, trade, and scholarly.

A statement in a scholarly source has a different intellectual weight than one in a popular source. For this reason, your instructor may request that you use scholarly sources in your paper.

This tutorial will help you distinguish scholarly periodicals from the other types.

Test Yourself: Types of Periodicals

Which of the following is not one of the three types of periodicals?

answers.response: Incorrect. Trade publications are one of the three types of periodicals.
Correct! Encyclopedias are not periodicals.
Incorrect. Scholarly publications are one of the three types of periodicals.
Incorrect. Popular publications are one of the three types of periodicals.

setContent.text:
Popular Periodicals

Popular periodicals (aka "magazines") are meant for a general audience. They might be truly general in scope (e.g., Life, Smithsonian) or be geared to enthusiasts with a specific interest.

Characteristics of popular periodicals include:

  • Appeal to a general readership: not much jargon
  • Lots of ads (print and website; not in library databases)
  • Authors are usually staff members or freelancers, not experts in the field.
  • Citations and references to other sources may be limited or absent.

Test Yourself: Popular Periodicals

Which of the following is most likely to be a popular periodical?

answers.response: Incorrect. Even if you know nothing about this journal, you can guess that something with the name of an academic field in the title will be scholarly. "Journal of" in the title is also a clue.
Incorrect. Even if you know nothing about this journal, you can guess that something with the name of an academic field in the title will be scholarly.
Incorrect. Even if you know nothing about this journal, you can guess that something with the name of an academic field in the title will be scholarly.
Correct! Rolling Stone is a popular periodical. It appeals to a very general readership, covering all aspects of popular culture.

setContent.text:
Trade Periodicals

Trade periodicals are directed at practitioners in a specific industry. While Bon Appétit is geared to home cooks, Restaurant Business (a trade publication) targets restaurant owners, with a focus on financial news and industry trends.

Characteristics of trade periodicals include:

  • Written for those employed in a particular industry or commercial sector
  • Article types include how-to and opinion pieces and news
  • Reports of original research are rare
  • Authors may be specialists in the field or journalists
  • Advertising aimed at professionals

Test Yourself: Trade Periodicals

Which of the following is most likely to be a trade periodical?

answers.response: Incorrect. This is a newspaper for a general audience: a popular periodical.
Incorrect. This is a news and culture magazine for a general audience: a popular periodical.
Correct! The phrase "Industry News" is a dead giveaway.
Incorrect. This is a scholarly journal. "Journal of" in the title is a hint.

setContent.text:
Scholarly Periodicals

Scholarly periodicals (aka "journals") are intended for academic researchers in a specific field. The Journal of Food Science publishes articles reporting the original research of food scientists, usually employed by universities or government labs.

Characteristics of scholarly periodicals include:

  • Titles might begin with "Journal of," "Proceedings of," or similar.
  • Authors will list their academic credentials.
  • Articles are divided into sections: abstract, methods, conclusions, etc.
  • Articles are peer reviewed.

Peer Review?

Peer review is a process by which scholarly articles are vetted for publication. Approval by an editor is usually all that is required for an article to be published in a popular or trade magazine, but a scholarly journal will require that an article be reviewed by experts in the field before it is published.

Pro Tip

Many library databases will indicate that an article is peer-reviewed and may let you filter your results to see only peer-reviewed articles.
setContent.imageAlt: Library catalog showing peer review facet

setContent.text:
Test Yourself

What kind of periodical does this come from?

answers.response: Incorrect. Notice the business jargon: "soft launch," "rollout" and the header "Breaking Industry Developments." This is for people in the candy business, not general lovers of chocolate.
Correct! Hints include business jargon like "soft launch" and "rollout" and the header "Breaking Industry Developments." This is for people in the candy business, not general lovers of chocolate.
Incorrect. Notice the business jargon: "soft launch," "rollout" and the header "Breaking Industry Developments." This is for people in the candy business, not general lovers of chocolate.

setContent.text:
Test Yourself

What kind of periodical does this come from?

answers.response: Correct! If Taylor Swift isn't popular, we don't know what is.
Incorrect. This is a general interest article about a celebrity. Articles like this come from popular periodicals.
Incorrect. This is a general interest article about a celebrity. Articles like this come from popular periodicals.

setContent.text:
Test Yourself

What kind of periodical does this come from?

answers.response: Incorrect. While dinosaurs are eternally popular, scientific terms like "ecomorphology" and "megaherbivorous" indicate that this is a scholarly article. Also notice the characteristic structure of the article outlined on the left.

Incorrect. This is a scholarly article written for paleontologists. Notice the scientific terms like "ecomorphology" and "megaherbivorous" as well as the characteristic structure of the article outlined on the left.
Correct! Hints include the use of scientific terms like "ecomorphology" and "megaherbivorous" as well as the characteristic stucture of the article outlined on the left.

setContent.text:
Test Yourself: Periodical Types

Classify the following periodicals as popular, trade, or scholarly by dragging them to the appropriate box.
setContent.incorrectResponse:
Not quite. Here are the correct answers:

Journal of Experimental PsychologyScholarly
The New YorkerPopular
California Dairy MagazineTrade
The Washington PostPopular
